bodyAches-None-title: I don't have any body aches.
bodyAches-Mild-title: I feel body aches sometimes. They don’t interfere with daily activities.
bodyAches-Moderate-title: I feel body aches regularly. They interfere with exercise or physical activities.
bodyAches-Severe-title: I feel body aches all the time. They interfere with daily activities such as bathing, getting dressed, eating and walking.
bodyAches-Severe-desc: You should get health advice. Call <1>8-1-1</1> or contact your health care provider
cough-description: <0>Contact your health care provider or call <1>8-1-1</1> if:<3><0>Your cough is getting worse</0><1>You start coughing up blood or phlegm</1><2>Your cough makes it hard to breathe</2></3></0>
cough-healthLinkBC: <0>Get more information from HealthLink BC about coughing:<1><0><0>Children age 11 and younger</0></0><1><0>People age 12 and older</0></1></1></0>
cough-Mild-title: I cough sometimes. It doesn’t interfere with daily activities.
cough-Moderate-title: I cough regularly, but it doesn’t interfere with daily activities.
cough-Severe-title: I cough all the time. It interferes with daily activities including eating, sleeping and exercising.
cough-Severe-desc: You should get health advice. Call <1>8-1-1</1> or contact your health care provider.
difficultBreathing-question: How severe is your shortness of breath?
difficultBreathing-description: If you are struggling to breathe or you can only speak in single words, call 9-1-1 or go to an <1><1>Urgent and Primary Care Centre (UPCC)</1></1> or emergency department right away.
difficultBreathing-Mild-title: I have difficulty breathing when I exercise or when I am active. It doesn’t interfere with daily activities.
difficultBreathing-Mild-desc: <0><0>If you start to have difficulty breathing while you’re doing regular activities like walking to the bathroom or walking up stairs, contact your health care provider or call <2>8-1-1</2> right away.</0><1>If you find it hard to breathe or can’t drink anything, call 9-1-1 or go to an <2>Urgent and Primary Care Centre (UPCC)</2> or emergency department right away.</1></0>
difficultBreathing-Moderate-title: I have difficulty breathing during certain daily activities. For example, when walking to the bathroom or walking up stairs.
difficultBreathing-Moderate-desc: <0><0>Contact your health care provider or call <1>8-1-1</1> right away.</0><1>If you find it hard to breathe or can’t drink anything, call 9-1-1 or go to an <2>Urgent and Primary Care Centre (UPCC)</2> or emergency department right away.</1></0>
difficultBreathing-Severe-title: I have difficulty breathing while doing normal daily activities. It’s also hard to breath when I’m resting.
difficultBreathing-Severe-desc: <0><0>You need medical attention. Call 9-1-1 or go to an <1>Urgent and Primary Care Centre (UPCC)</1> or emergency department right away.</0></0>
bodyAches-question: How severe are your body aches?
soreThroat-question: How severe is your sore throat?
soreThroat-description: <0><0>If your pain is increasing or if you’re having trouble swallowing, contact your health care provider or call <1>8-1-1</1> right away.</0><1>If you find you can’t drink anything, call 9-1-1 or go to an <1>Urgent and Primary Care Centre (UPCC)</1> or emergency department right away.</1><2>Get more information from <2>HealthLink BC</2> about sore throats.</2></0>
soreThroat-None-title: I don't have a sore throat.
soreThroat-Mild-title: I have a throat tickle or discomfort. I can swallow or speak without difficulty.
soreThroat-Moderate-title: I feel pain in my throat when I swallow or speak.
soreThroat-Moderate-desc: If you're having trouble swallowing, contact your health care provider or call <1>8-1-1</1> right away.
soreThroat-Severe-title: I feel pain in my throat. It interferes with swallowing, eating or speaking.
soreThroat-Severe-desc: If you find you can’t drink anything, call 9-1-1 or go to an<1> Urgent and Primary Care Centre (UPCC)</1> or emergency department right away.
headache-description: <0>If you have a severe headache that started suddenly and is the worst headache of your life, call 9-1-1 or go to an <1>Urgent and Primary Care Centre (UPCC)</1> or emergency department right away.</0><1>Get more information from <2>Healthlink BC</2> about headaches.</1>
headache-Mild-title: I have a headache that doesn’t interfere with daily activities.
headache-Moderate-title: I have a headache that interferes with exercise or physical activity.
headache-Severe-title: I have a headache that interferes with daily activities like bathing, getting dressed, eating and walking.
diarrhea-description: <0>Contact your health care provider or call <1>8-1-1</1> if:</0><1><0>Your diarrhea is getting worse</0><1>You have bloody diarrhea or black, tarry stool</1><2>You are dehydrated, for example, you don’t have to pee very often or you feel light-headed when you stand up</2></1><2>Get more information from <2>Healthlink BC</2> about diarrhea.</2>
diarrhea-Mild-title: I have loose stools 2 to 3 times each day (within 24 hours).
diarrhea-Moderate-title: I have loose stools 4 to 10 times each day (within 24 hours).
diarrhea-Severe-title: I have loose stools more than 10 times each day (within 24 hours).
diarrhea-Severe-desc: <0>You should get health advice. Call <1>8-1-1</1> or contact your health care provider.</0>
nauseaVomiting-question: How severe is your nausea or vomiting?
nauseaVomiting-description: <0>Contact your health care provider or call <1>8-1-1</1> if:<3><0>You're not able to keep down even small sips of water</0><1>You are dehydrated, for example, you don’t have to pee very often or you feel light-headed when you stand up</1></3></0>
nausea-healthLinkBC: <0>Get more information from HealthLink BC about nausea and vomiting:<1><0><0>Children age 11 and younger</0></0><1><0>People age 12 and older</0></1></1></0>
nauseaVomiting-None-title: I don't have nausea. I have not been vomiting.
nauseaVomiting-Mild-title: I have nausea sometimes. I have vomited a few times.
nauseaVomiting-Moderate-title: I have nausea regularly. I have vomited multiple times.
nauseaVomiting-Severe-title: I have nausea all the time. I vomit often. It interferes with daily activities.
nauseaVomiting-Severe-desc: You should get health advice. Call <1>8-1-1</1> or contact your health care provider.
